cyclone.name: HARVEY
cyclone.current_location: about 365 miles SE of Corpus Christi, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: tracking northwest toward the middle Texas coast then expected to slow and stall near the coast through the weekend
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: middle Texas coast near Port O'Connor–Matagorda, TX

weather_observation.watch_coast: North of San Luis Pass to High Island, TX (Storm Surge Watch)
weather_observation.warning_coast: North of Matagorda to High Island, TX (Tropical Storm Warning)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Middle and upper Texas coast, including Galveston Bay and adjacent shoreline
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (≥39 mph) are likely to reach Galveston Friday afternoon or evening, with a 59 % cumulative chance; brief hurricane-force gusts are possible if the core tracks farther north.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Storm surge of 2–4 ft above ground level possible for the Galveston–High Island stretch, especially around high tide Friday night into Saturday.
weather_observation.rainfall: Extreme rainfall of 12–20 inches with isolated 30 inches possible through early next week, producing life-threatening freshwater flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents; prolonged flooding due to the storm stalling near the coast may disrupt port access roads and rail connections.
